body: r_c always idolized m_c and modeled {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} ideal of what it meant to be a true and good c_n cat on m_c. Without {PRONOUN/m_c/object}, r_c feels like {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}{VERB/r_c/'ve/'s} been set adrift.

r_c never realized just how high of a pedestal {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} had placed m_c on, but with {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} parent gone - it feels like r_c's world has come crashing down around {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} ears.

r_c stares in disbelief at the body of {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} parent. How can c_n go on without m_c? {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/were/was} the solid foundation upon which c_n rested, in r_c's mind - and now that foundation has crumbled.

r_c presses {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} muzzle to the cold body of m_c, choking back sobs. All the spark and life that r_c always admired in {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} parent has faded, leaving nothing but a husk behind.
r_c admired m_c so deeply - as a parent, but also as a Clanmate and a teacher. This loss cuts {PRONOUN/r_c/object} to {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} core.
Looking at {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} parent's body, r_c is too overcome to speak. How will {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} go on without m_c? How will c_n survive without {PRONOUN/m_c/object}?

r_c presses against m_c's cold flank and tells {PRONOUN/m_c/object} again and again how loved and cherished {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/are/is}, and how much {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/look/looks} up to {PRONOUN/m_c/object}. Knowing m_c can't hear {PRONOUN/r_c/object} now breaks {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} heart.
r_c grieves m_c deeply, knowing that {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} may never have the chance to tell {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} parent what a profound impact {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} had on {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} life.
